interesting_fact: Based on the novella by Stephen King, this film initially struggled at the box office but gained widespread acclaim later.
The script was written as the movie was being filmed, and the ending was undecided until late in the production.
A silent film released well into the era of talkies, and it remains one of Charlie Chaplin's masterpieces.
One of the first films to use Technicolor, transitioning from sepia tones to full color in the journey to Oz.
The severed horse head in the film was a real horse head sourced from a dog food company.
The famous shower scene was shot with 78 camera setups and 52 cuts in just three minutes.
The iconic opening crawl was inspired by the Flash Gordon serials, and George Lucas had to fight to keep it in the film.
The rotating hallway fight scene was a practical effect using a rotating set, not CGI.
The T-Rex roar is a combination of the sounds of a baby elephant, a tiger, and an alligator.
The falling green code is a combination of symbols from Japanese, Korean, and Chinese languages.
